juice noun
(LIQUID)
Add to word list

A1 [ U ] the liquid that comes from fruit or vegetables: orange/lemon/grapefruit/carrot juice a carton of apple juice
Image Source/GettyImages
[ C ] an amount or type of juice: I don't drink alcohol so I relaxed with a couple of orange juices. They reported that contaminants in some "fresh" whole orange juices are up to 10 times higher than levels in local tap water. juices
[ plural ] the liquid in meat: Sear the meat first to seal in the juices.

juice noun
(POWER)
[ U ] informal the power in a battery (= a device that produces electricity): Make sure there's plenty of juice in your phone before you set off.
[ U ] informal electrical power in general: Wind power is often cheaper than other types of juice.
[ U ] informal petrol: The car's running low on juice.
[ U ] US slang, informal power or influence: My cousin Gianni's got all the juice in this neighborhood.
